Who You AreYou are devoted, compassionate, and enjoy being on the front lines in healthcare, changing the lives of your patients. You are passionate about getting to the root cause of a patient’s conditions, removing social determinants of healthcare, and ensuring the highest possible quality of life for those in your care. You don’t want to sacrifice quality over quantity, and you aim to provide the same level of care and commitment to your patients that you would to your own family member. Does this sound like you? If so, we should talk.Who We AreWe are Honest Medical Group, a groundbreaking team of healthcare professionals focused on making a major impact in healthcare. At Honest we align every aspect of our health plans to support patients seeing our providers; we drive health improvements, create a seamless member experience, and eliminate duplicative costs. We listen to the needs of our patients and our employees, continually working to push beyond the status quo in which the care system manages patients today. For us, it’s all in an Honest day’s work. Your RoleThe VP Data, Data Analytics and Data Science will lead the technical arm of Data Analytics and BI cohort. On top of oversight of the technical team, you will design the roadmap and execute on the plan to improve and maintain our existing infrastructure in Snowflake and Tableau. You closely collaborate along with the analytics arm of the cohort to address complex data needs across the business including differing lines of business, sales, marketing, compliance, health plan/provider enablement operations, product management, and finance, to provide the system that the teams use to gain actionable strategic and operational insights.ResponsibilitiesDesign architecture for and oversee the “back end” development of TableauCollaborate with data engineers and work independently to: (1) improve the loading time of dashboards and (2) reconcile the differences between data/results in Tableau dashboards and the various sources of the dataCollaborate with data engineers on infrastructure projects to improve ingestion pipelines and sourcing new dataBuild relationships with team leads across the company and serve as a bridge between teams across the business and the data analysts and data engineers to improve infrastructure to provide better insights and optimize processesSupport the business analysts, who build Dashboards and Looks requested by teams across the business, and ensure the accuracy, relevance, quality, and impact of the team deliverablesProvide strategic and operational insight backed by data to functional teams across the companyDiagnose and optimize data processes to improve efficiencyBecome a subject matter expert on our systems integrations and assisting others to fully utilize these platformsQualificationsMinimum 7+ years of hands on experience in data, data ingestion, data architecture5+ years of experience in healthcare standard and non standardized file sharing mechanisms and techniques.3+ years of experience in leading a teamExperience in Provider Enablement, Value Based Care, and population management tooling.Experience in a leadership role of an analytical, consulting, research, or strategy team using business intelligence platforms such as Tableau, SQL, SSIS, or Power BIUnderstanding of CMS innovator/100% data usage in benchmarking health care populationsStrong ETL/ELT tooling skillsExperience working with extremely large datasetsStrong analytical and critical thinking skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to distill complex analysis into concise takeawaysAbility to manage multiple competing priorities and projectsSolid grasp of statistics and data modelingHow You Are SupportedAs a full-time team member, you will benefit from Honest’s exceptional total rewards package, including competitive base pay with bonuses, paid time off starting at 4 weeks for full time employees, 12 paid holidays per year, reimbursement for continuing medical education, 401k with match, health, dental, and vision insurance. As a part-time team member, you will benefit from Honest’s total rewards package, including competitive base pay with bonuses, pro-rated paid time off, paid holidays, reimbursement for continuing medical education, 401k with match. Family friendly policies that support paid parental leave and flexible work arrangementsAs a team member you’ll be supported by our robust commitment to training and development that starts with onboarding and continues throughout your career with HonestYou will collaborate with like-minded healthcare professionals who, like you, understand the importance and value of Honest’s high-quality, value-based, care model.Honest is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.Honest will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.Honest is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should email careers@HonestMedicalGroup.com for assistance. Reasonable accommodation will be determined on a case-by-case basis.
